results.title: Adventure playgrounds
results.creator_credit: National Playing Fields Association and Stanley Schofield
results.brief_description: An adventure playground can be created by children themselves, out of scrap materials on a piece of wasteland. It can provide an outlet for energy, a means for building self-confidence, and reducing the juvenile delinquency rate. Discusses the importance of the play leader.

results.title: Adventure playground: London
results.brief_description: Filmed in one of the Greater London Council’s adventure playgrounds where activities are built around tall forest trees. It shows the playground activities which appeal to children and in which they can engage with comparative safety and security in the presence of a play leader. All types of play equipment are obviously enjoyed by the children of all ages in the delightful park setting. A non-narrated films blending music and playground noises in its soundtrack.

results.title: Adventure Island: The Diamond Tree
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), John Michael Howson and Godfrey Philipp
results.brief_description:
Ho ho, ho ho, its far away we go, to a land that’s far across the sea. Hey hey, hey hey, for a little while we’ll stay, and be home in time for tea……..

The popular long-running children’s program ‘Adventure Island’ is set in the kingdom of Diddley-Dum-Diddley, and follows the continuing adventures of Liza, Clown, Mrs Flower Potts, Percy and Dodo Panda and their friends.

In this episode, a magical plant produces diamond flowers.

results.title: Adventure in Venice
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and John Barnes
results.brief_description: Presents aspects of day-to-day life in Venice. Tells a story about a boy who loses a prized model ship on the waterways of his city. Gives a comprehensive view of this water dependent city, noting the historic sites and large tourist trade.
results.description: Presents aspects of day-to-day life in Venice. Tells a story about a boy who loses a prized model ship on the waterways of his city. Gives a comprehensive view of this water dependent city, noting the historic sites and large tourist trade.

results.title: Adventure in Newfoundland
results.brief_description: A boy’s adventure on Green Island, New Foundland. Gulls, puffins, murres, kittiwakes and other winged fishers occupy every inch of space where young Tom accompanies a bird-banding expedition. When a rope slips and a bad fall threatens, Tom makes a quick, sure-footed recovery.

results.title: Adventure in maturity
results.creator_credit: Oklahoma. State Dept. of Health and University of Oklahoma
results.brief_description: A middle-aged woman living with her son constantly thinks of the ‘old days’. Through the intervention of an old friend, her interest in life is re-awakened as she visits a beauty parlour and rejuvenates her appearance, takes a job in the community and is once more busy and active.

results.title: Adventure has wings
results.creator_credit: Royal Society for the Protection of Birds and Anthony Clay
results.brief_description: Shows the variety of birds in Britain in different situations as seen by two town children, two country children, and their friends. How the RSPB’s Young Ornithologist’s Club makes birdwatching more enjoyable more adventurous. Designed for showing to children aged 9-13 years to increase their interest in birds and birdwatching.

results.title: Advances in cheddar cheesemaking
results.brief_description: Designed primarily for the cheese industry. Firstly it shows the traditional method of cheesemaking and then it describes a mechanical process developed to reduce the time and labour required.

results.title: Advancement of women in poor rural areas
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jean Dansereau, J.-P. Olivier Fougeres and Michel Regnier
results.brief_description: The English version of a film that was shot mainly in Bhatshala-Shapmari, in the north of Bangladesh, and at Savar and Dapashai in the center of the country. We see the efforts of teams from Gonoshasthaya Kendra to free women from poor villages from submission and misery. Through health care, education and professional courses, medical assistants and social workers allow countrywomen to benefit from their nation’s progress. Part three of the series.
